title: Union Ministers hail ‚Äòhistoric‚Äô India-U.S. trade deal; Congress says PM has ‚Äòcapitulated finally‚Äô

content: Betul Chief Medical and Health Officer Dr. Manoj Hurmade confirmed the child‚Äôs death and said the post-mortem examination was conducted in Nagpur, and the body was handed over to the family

title: ISRO tests thrust chamber for LOX-Methane Engine
content: The test was conducted at the Thrust Chamber Test facility at ISRO Propulsion Complex (IPRC), Mahendragiri on January 27, 2026

title: Survey in and around Kolkata shows most students in 17-24 age group read books only occasionally
content: According to the survey, conducted by the Kolkata-based Sabar Institute and the Sarojini Naidu College for Women, 35% of students in the age group 17-24 years read only occasionally while 25% sat with a book daily

title: Rajasthan fully prepared to take advantage of budgetary incentives: CM
content: ‚ÄúThe Union Budget will give new strength to all-round development of Rajasthan and support our resolve to achieve the development goals‚Ä¶ It is a roadmap for a developed India,‚Äù Rajasthan CM Bhajan Lal Sharma said

title: SAD claims Majithia a victim of political vendetta, after he gets bail in DA case
content: Senior SAD leaders Daljit Singh Cheema and Arshdeep Singh Kler alleged the State government had concocted a false disproportionate assets case against Mr. Majithia

title: BJP names Tarun Chugh as observer for Legislature Party leader election in Manipur
content: MHA calls meeting with Kuki-Zo insurgent groups¬†in indication that elected government could be restored in Manipur soon

title: Tamil Biennale will be held in January 2027, Stalin says at Global Tourism Summit
content: State govt. signs 127 MoUs worth ‚Çπ22,794 crore, which are likely to create 65,937 jobs. Tourism infrastructure such as theme parks and camping sites will be set up at 31 locations, says CM

title: 196 illegal Bangladeshi immigrants deported and another 370 have been identified, says Karnataka Home Minister
content: Home Minister G. Parameshwara on Monday told the Legislative Assembly that 196 illegal Bangladeshi immigrants had been deported from Karnataka so far, while another 370 had been identified under the ongoing drive in this regard

title: Three booked on cheating charge
content: The Kothamangalam police registered a case against three people, including two local BJP leaders, for allegedly cheating a 58-year-old man of nearly ‚Çπ10 lakh

title: Kufos launches new initiative to conserve Kadamakudy
content: As the first phase of the initiative, Kufos will undertake a detailed local-level survey in Kadamakudy panchayat

title: National security on a slippery regional landscape
content: India‚Äôs national security will experience regional turbulence with minimal involvement in the larger international security landscape

title: Rise in southern States‚Äô share in devolution of funds provides no relief to Tamil Nadu
content: The share of Tamil Nadu, which was 4.079% in the 15th FC, rose to 4.097% now, accounting for a rate of increase of only 0.44%; as part of horizontal devolution, the weights assigned to the criteria of area, demographic performance and per-capita GSDP (Gross State Domestic Product) have reduced affecting States like T.N and Kerala

title: A hat tip to Tamil Nadu‚Äôs industrial strength, reforms
content: The Economic Survey of India (2025-26) reinforces Tamil Nadu‚Äôs position as an investment-ready, industry-first State

title: Mob vandalises, torches homes in Chhattisgarh village as police shield minority residents against them
content: At least seven policemen suffered injuries while shielding over two dozen people, including women and children, against a mob of hundreds for several hours

title: Sarbananda Sonowal targets Congress for alleged corruption, scams
content: The Minister alleges prolonged neglect of the northeastern region by previous Congress governments, says Prime Minister Narendra Modi calls the region ‚ÄòAshtalakshmi‚Äô

title: West Bengal Government questions maintainability of ED plea in Supreme Court on I-PAC case
content: The State asked whether the petition was maintainable when a similar case was pending before the Calcutta High Court urging identical grounds of challenge

title: NDA Parliamentary party meeting on February 3
content: MPs belonging to the BJP, TDP, JD(U), LJP (R), Shiv Sena, JD(S) and other constituents of the NDA will attend the meeting. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to address the lawmakers on a host of issues at the meeting, sources said

title: Rajasthan SIR: Bulk Form 7 applications for voter name deletion surface in Barmer; BJP BLAs deny filing them
content: Hundreds of Form 7 applications seeking deletion of voter names surface mysteriously in Rajasthan‚Äôs Chohtan Assembly constituency; booth-level agents of the BJP in whose names the forms had been filed say they have not signed them

title: BJP accuses Rahul Gandhi of ‚Äòmisleading‚Äô the nation on 2017 Doklam issue
content: ‚ÄúRahul Gandhi is not only wounding the dignity of Parliament through continuous false accusations and statements that spread confusion, but he is also hurting the morale of our valiant soldiers,‚Äù says BJP MP

content: Agreed to a trade deal between the United States and India, says U.S. President Trump; India will ‚Äòbuy much more from the United States and potentially, Venezuela‚Äô, he adds

title: Form 7 filings for deletion of names from electoral rolls spark outrage in Gujarat
content: Voters have claimed that their names, phone, and EPIC details were misused, and signatures forged to file false claims; Opposition parties blame the BJP, while the ruling party says SIR exercise is a transparent process and neither the party nor the government has any role in filing the applications

title: Inflow of synthetic drugs in Kochi raises concern
content: While suspected ganja and MDMA make up most of the narcotics seized by the authorities, annual data from the police and the Excise show that peddlers have also found a market for other addictive substances in the city and its suburbs

title: Tri-Services Future Warfare Course begins at Manekshaw Centre
content: According to the Ministry of Defence, this edition features an enhanced and expanded curriculum, focusing on specialised subjects and domain-specific developments shaping contemporary and future military operations.

title: Defence Minister approves Miniratna-I status for Yantra India Limited
content: The company‚Äôs major product portfolio includes carbon fibre composites; assembly products for medium and large calibre ammunition; armoured vehicles; artillery guns and main battle tanks; glass composites; and aluminium alloys

title: Rabid stray dog bites five people in¬†Udayamperoor, two in¬†Thripunithura
content: The dog was eventually caught by a team of animal handlers from the Kochi Corporation on January 31, 2026, says local body representatives

title: Grand plans in the making for Idukki hydel project‚Äôs  golden jubilee
content: The ‚Äòbirthday‚Äô of Kerala‚Äôs largest hydroelectric project falls on February 12. The first stage of the project was dedicated to the nation in 1976 by the then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi

title: In Rajya Sabha, Opposition flags farm distress, surge in migration, rising human-wildlife conflict
content: BJD‚Äôs Sasmit Patra questions the lack of paddy procurement in Odisha, CPI(M)‚Äôs John Brittas attacks former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, transferring wildlife into the Concurrent List, handicapping the States

title: Student activists stage protest against shifting of IIIT from Ongole
content: Student JAC leaders express concerns over drinking water crisis and other issues at new campus in Ballipalli village of Kanigiri mandal

title: Cyberabad Police launches e-Office system to move towards paperless administration
content: Move aimed at streamlining file processing, improving accountability and reducing delays in decision making

title: Opposition in Rajya Sabha slams address by the President
content: In Rajya Sabha, Congress MP Digvijaya Singh demands explanation from government on the remarks by former Army chief M.M. Naravane on the 2020 India-China conflict in his unpublished memoirs

title: Congress says government is misusing rules to silence Leader of Opposition from quoting Naravane‚Äôs book on China border issue
content: Congress general secretary K.C. Venugopal says the government is afraid that the ‚Äútruth of its incompetence‚Äù will be exposed.

title: Faunal survey uncovers new species in Karimpuzha Wildlife Sanctuary
content: The survey, carried out from January 22 to 25 documented 171 bird species, 177 species of butterflies, and 42 species of odonates, with several recorded in the sanctuary for the first time

title: JSP leaders should counter YSRCP propaganda on laddu issue: Pawan Kalyan
content: Deputy Chief Minister asks party leaders not to remain silent after SIT findings, says ghee adulteration could not have occurred without involvement of YSRCP leaders and TTD officials

title: Those indulging in wrongdoing are bound to face inquiries, says CM
content: Mr. Revanth Reddy gives strong counter to the allegations and claims made by BRS leaders BRS on notices served on KCR

title: Ernakulam MCH¬†outpatient services unaffected by¬†KGMCTA¬†stir
content: A total of 1,553 patients sought medical services at the department on the day, most of them unaware that such a strike was under way

title: Investigation into PSLV failures ‚Äòongoing‚Äô, next launch date in June: Minister
content: The PSLV is ISRO‚Äôs most successful satellite launch vehicle, and since 1993, has had an over 90% success rate, placing nearly 350 satellites into their intended orbits

title: Skywalk proposed along Raidurg-T-Hub stretch to improve pedestrian safety in Cyberabad
content: Proposed facility is aimed at providing a continuous and safe pedestrian network through skywalks and tunnels, while also easing vehicular movement

title: Rejuvenation of Tiruneermalai tank has started, temple executive officer tells Madras HC
content: He says the project cost has been estimated to be somewhere between ‚Çπ63 lakh and ‚Çπ65 lakh, and a devotee has come forward to donate the entire amount

title: YSRCP vows legal return gift to TDP over alleged attacks
content: Party coordinator Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy alleges TDP-led violence, police bias and a bid to divert attention from the Tirupati laddu row

title: IAF‚Äôs Sarang team to showcase Dhruv helicopter at Singapore airshow
content: Known for precision flying, close-formation manoeuvres and disciplined execution, Sarang display highlights the operational versatility, agility and reliability of ALH Dhruv across a wide range of missions

title: Congress launches statewide yatra to defend MGNREGA from Centre‚Äôs ‚Äòdilution‚Äô
content: On the 20th anniversary of the rural employment guarantee law, APCC president Y.S. Sharmila warns that the VB Gram G initiative weakens legally assured job security for millions in Andhra Pradesh

title: Man sentenced to double life imprisonment for murdering wife
content: Alappuzha Additional Sessions Judge Bharathi S. awarded the sentence to Rajeshkumar alias Rajan of Pallipuram near Cherthala for murdering his wife Ambili in 2024

title: Aikalabava Kanthabare-Boodabare Jodukare Kambala to celebrate golden jubilee this year
content: The Kambala will begin at 9.30 a.m. on February 7 at Aikala village in Mangaluru taluk of Dakshina Kannada

title: BJP/RSS activists acquitted in murder case of DYFI activist
content: Court says prosecution failed to prove that the accused were involved in the conspiracy and assault that led to the death in 2013

title: In three years, Central higher educational institutes filled 28,000 posts
content: Of them, 12% posts have been filled by Scheduled Castes, 5% by Scheduled Tribes, and 21% by Other Backward Classes, Minister of State for Education Sukanta Majumdar tells Parliament in response to a question

title: Robotics kit distribution begins in Kerala schools
content: The new advanced kits are being distributed to empower students to build IoT (Internet of Things)-based devices

title: Not all AIIMS are in robust health, says B. Ekbal
content: Public health activist says of the 26 AIIMS, only the first phase establishments are faring relatively well. Major problems facing the newer institutions are an acute shortage of doctors, infrastructure issues and crowding of patients. Kerala too might face the same issues, despite the State boasting a strong PHC network

title: How MGNREGA changed caste and gender relations, and why workers fear losing it
content: Workers¬†argue that the new framework weakens the demand-driven, rights-based nature of the law that has sustained rural households for¬†nearly two¬†decades, especially during lean agricultural seasons.

title: Sources: Bucks countering trade offers for Giannis
content: The Bucks have submitted counteroffers to teams aggressively seeking a trade for two-time MVP Giannis Antetokounmpo, sources told ESPN.

title: NFL to reevaluate Rooney Rule: 'More work to do'
content: NFL commissioner Roger Goodell said Monday that the league will take a closer a look at the Rooney Rule and all that it encompasses after an offseason hiring cycle that saw only one of 10 head-coaching jobs go to a minority candidate.

title: Goodell: Belichick will eventually be Hall of Famer
content: NFL commissioner Roger Goodell said Monday the league has nothing to do with the vote for the Pro Football Hall of Fame and that he believes Bill Belichick will eventually be inducted.

title: Sources: M's deal for Cards All-Star Donovan
content: The Mariners acquired infielder/outfielder Brendan Donovan from the Cardinals, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan. Donovan was a first-time All-Star last season.

title: Six teams leave RSN Main Street to join MLB
content: Six teams officially left their regional sports network, Main Street Sports, and joined Major League Baseball on Monday, essentially shedding their local-media contracts.

title: Hornets' Lee sorry for 'foolish' collision with Ball
content: An embarrassed Charles Lee took the blame for a head-to-head collision with his star player on the sideline after LaMelo Ball and the Hornets coach both went for a loose ball.

title: Sources: Browns hiring Ravens' Switzer to be OC
content: The Browns are hiring Ravens run game coordinator Travis Switzer to be their offensive coordinator, league sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter, bringing a trusted assistant from Baltimore to join new coach Todd Monken's staff.

title: NFL to look into Tisch's Epstein files connection
content: The NFL said Monday that it is aware emails released by the Justice Department on Friday show that convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein connected Giants co-owner Steve Tisch with numerous women and that it will look into the matter.

title: üèà NFL mock draft: Projecting the first two rounds
content: Matt Miller goes two rounds deep in his latest mock. Which prospects rose after the Senior Bowl? Which teams need quarterbacks?

content: Today is the 150th anniversary of the National League. We take a look at each league going into the 2026 season.

content: This winter transfer window had its share of perplexing player moves. Here are our winners and losers.

content: The USA and Minnesota star's game features highlight-reel assists and goals, penalties and physical play.

content: Our NBA insiders answer the biggest questions for the Lakers, Mavericks and the NBA one year after the shocking Luka Doncic trade.

content: From Bruno Mars to Gloria Estefan, a wide array of Hispanic superstars has graced the Super Bowl halftime stage. Reflect on top performances now.

content: Once upon a time, 600 young adults smiled as one, danced in pastel outfits and sang about positivity.

content: Mike Maccagnan and former teammates of Darnold talked openly and emotionally about their unwavering faith in the QB.

content: Are we approaching the end of the Pep Guardiola era at Man City? Plus: Man United grab another win and Real Madrid get booed heavily at home, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

content: Carlos Alcaraz and Elena Rybakina are the newly crowned Australian Open champions. Who will win the rest of the majors? We make predictions.

title: Why Shakur Stevenson's next possible challenger isn't a world champion
content: Shakur Stevenson dominated Teofimo Lopez Jr. and looked unbeatable. But he's still looking for bigger challenges.

content: Which fights were the standouts from UFC 325? Andreas Hale grades all the matchups from Saturday's fight card in Sydney.

title: Super Bowl LX betting buzz: Who's the favorite to be the fastest ball carrier?
content: After a week of betting, sportsbooks are split on how to handle the heavy volume on Seattle to cover the spread.

title: Pickups: Bailey, Jerome, Demin among top players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Explainer: What's Next For Trump's Gaza Plan After Rafah Reopening?
content: US President Donald Trump's plan to end the Gaza war was given a boost on Monday with the reopening of the enclave's Rafah crossing with Egypt. But difficult questions remain unaddressed, including whether Hamas will disarm.

title: Bill, Hillary Clinton To Testify Before US House In Epstein Probe
content: Bill and Hillary Clinton will testify in a US House investigation surrounding deceased sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, a spokesman for the ex-president said Monday, heading off a potential vote to hold the couple in contempt.

title: Russia Says It Is Not Mediating Pakistan's Ties With India, Afghanistan
content: Russia on Monday said that it is not a mediator in resolving Pakistan's tensions with India and  Afghanistan, adding that it is ready to provide any assistance if requested.

title: US-Iran Meeting To Take Place In Turkey On February 6: Report
content: A meeting between the United States and Iran is likely to take place in Turkey on February 6, an Arab official told AFP on Tuesday, after Tehran called for the restart of nuclear talks and Washington warned of consequences if a deal was not reached.

title: Mumbai Police Traces Scooter Used In Firing At Rohit Shetty's Residence
content: In a key development in the ongoing probe into the firing incident at filmmaker Rohit Shetty's Mumbai residence, the Mumbai police have traced the Honda Dio scooter used in the attack to a man from Pune.

title: Maharashtra Man Kills 6-Year-Old Daughter To Contest Panchayat Elections
content: A man from Maharashtra killed one of his three children to overcome the two-child norm to contest the upcoming Panchayat elections in that state.

title: All B-787 Must Be Grounded, Checked For Electrical Faults: Pilots' Body Chief
content: President of the Federation of Indian Pilots (FIP), Captain CS Randhawa, on Monday called for urgent inspections of all Boeing 787 aircraft for electrical system faults, citing recurring incidents that he said compromise flight safety.

title: Musk's SpaceX To Merge With xAI At Combined Valuation Of $1.25 Trillion: Report
content: Elon Musk plans to merge SpaceX with xAI ahead of its IPO, with a combined valuation of $1.25 trillion, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.

title: Trump Urges "No Changes" To Bill To End Shutdown
content: US President Donald Trump urged the House of Representatives on Monday to swiftly adopt a spending bill and end the three-day government shutdown.

title: US Justice Department Says Epstein Files With Victim Info Taken Down
content: The Justice Department said Monday that it had taken down several thousand documents and "media" that may have inadvertently included victim-identifying information since it began releasing the latest batch of documents related Jeffrey Epstein.

title: US-India Trade Deal Will Pave Way For Stronger Ties: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said the trade deal between the US and India will elevate strategic partnership between the two countries, paving the way for stronger trade ties and mutual growth.

title: Delivery Agent Stabbed To Death In Delhi, 3 Minors Arrested: Cops
content: A 22-year-old delivery executive was stabbed to death by three minors in east Delhi's Pandav Nagar on Monday following an altercation, police said. The juveniles have been apprehended.

title: In Deepam Row Contempt Case, Madurai Collector Offers Unconditional Apology
content: The Madurai district administration on Monday sought to defuse the escalating legal row over the lighting of the Karthigai Deepam at the Thiruparankundram hilltop, with the District Collector filing an unconditional apology.

title: Communal Clash, Arson In Chhattisgarh, Three Arrested
content: A violent clash erupted between two communities in Gariaband district of Chhattisgarh over an old dispute, triggering large-scale unrest on Sunday.

title: UK PM Keir Starmer Orders Probe Into Sacked Envoy's Epstein Links
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer has ordered an urgent inquiry into the ties between London's former ambassador to Washington, Peter Mandelson, and the late US sex offender Jeffrey Epstein during the politician's time as a government minister.

title: US Envoy To Meet Iran Foreign Minister On Friday To Discuss Nuclear Deal
content: US President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff and Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi plan to meet on Friday in Istanbul to discuss a possible nuclear deal and other issues, a US official said on Monday.

title: BJP Appoints Central Observer For Manipur Leader Amid Government Formation Buzz
content: The BJP on Monday appointed its National General Secretary Tarun Chugh as the central observer for the election of the legislature party leader in Manipur, indicating the possible formation of a government.

title: Always Stood By Siddaramaiah, Will Continue To Do So: DK Shivakumar
content: Seeking to junk claims of power tussle in the state, Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar on Monday asserted that he has always stood by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and will continue to do so in future as well.

title: Sonam Wangchuk Tried To Instigate Nepal-Like Gen Z Protests: Centre
content: The Centre and the Union Territory of Ladakh administration told the Supreme Court on Monday that jailed climate activist Sonam Wangchuk tried to instigate Gen Z for protests like in Nepal and Bangladesh.

title: Total Tariff On India To Be 18%: US Ambassador Sergio Gor to NDTV
content: US Ambassador to India Sergio Gor today congratulated both Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Donald Trump after both leaders confirmed reciprocal tariffs have been reduced to 18 per cent.

title: US tariff cut from 50% to 18%: Top 7 points Trump says he agreed on with PM Modi
content: Trump had imposed a 50% tariff on India, 25% of which were for crude oil imports from Russia. Trump administration officials have repeatedly claimed that India‚Äôs crude purchase from Russia helped finance the latter‚Äôs war against Russia.

title: Cheer for exports: Textiles, carpets, leather set to gain after India-US deal
content: With the trade deal announced, Indian goods are suddenly looking more competitive. This means that a product will face 18% additional tariff over the MFN or product-specific rate. At 18%, the levy on Indian garments will be marginally lower than the 20% faced by those made in Bangladesh or Sri Lanka.

title: AI Boeing fuel switch cuts off again, this time at UK airport
content: The switch moved without the required lift action, suggesting the safeguard meant to prevent fuel supply cut off and inadvertent engine shutdown did not function as designed, sources said. The London incident challenges the controversial narrative that the Ahmedabad crash resulted from a deliberate pilot act, pointing instead to a possible and critical technical flaw in the aircraft‚Äôs fuel switch design.

title: Despite Cameron Green's 'chucking' gesture, Usman Khawaja defends Pakistan bowler - 'Stigma is real'
content: Usman Khawaja backed Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq after Cameron Green‚Äôs ‚Äúchucking‚Äù gesture sparked debate. Khawaja urged restraint, saying Tariq was cleared twice and asked critics to ‚Äústop jumping to conclusions.‚Äù Tariq explained his action stems from a biological elbow issue and stressed he is not throwing. Tariq remains a key part of Pakistan‚Äôs T20 World Cup plans.

title: Accused of body-shaming professor, Gujarat nursing student hangs himself
content: A first-year nursing student in Nadiad died by suicide, leaving a note denying allegations of body-shaming professors and claiming he was wrongly framed. His father alleges the college administration deliberately isolated and pressured his son, leading to his depression. College authorities deny wrongdoing, stating they intervened after complaints about the student's conduct.

title: As Amazon lays off 16000, AWS VP Greg Pearson tells employees: Continue using ...
content: Amazon has axed 16,000 corporate jobs, its second-largest layoff in months. Leadership is urging remaining staff to leverage technology for efficiency and support one another. This move aligns with CEO Andy Jassy's vision of AI driving future workforce changes and streamlining operations, while the company continues to invest in strategic areas.

title: Epstein case: Hillary and Bill Clinton to testify in House
content: Bill and Hillary Clinton will testify before the house oversight committee regarding Jeffrey Epstein, averting criminal contempt charges.  Attorneys confirmed their compliance, though final deposition dates are pending.  Chairman James Comer insists on sworn testimony, rejecting alternative proposals.  This development follows Republican efforts to compel their appearance, marking a significant congressional action.

title: Govt spent only 5% of funds for job, skilling schemes in FY 2026
content: Latest budget data released Sunday shows that govt spent nearly Rs 1,730 crore on the three components of the programme in FY26, out of a total of Rs 33,830 crore allocated in the 2024-25 budget. With the internship scheme having seen only two pilots, the Centre spent Rs 526 crore of Rs 10,800 crore allocated during FY26.

title: Trade deal done, says Trump; PM Modi thanks him for cutting tariff to 18%
content: While PM Narendra Modi, in a post on X, which followed US President Donald Trump‚Äôs announcement on Truth Social, said he had a wonderful conversation with ‚Äúdear friend‚Äù Trump and thanked him on behalf of 1.4 billion people for the reduced tariff of 18% on Indian goods, he did not mention the trade deal at all in his post on X that followed Trump‚Äôs ‚Äúwonderful‚Äù announcement.

title: Oracle may layoff up to 30,000; one of the reasons is firm's 'commitment'
content: Oracle faces potential job cuts of 20,000-30,000 to fund its massive $156 billion OpenAI partnership. The company has already incurred significant debt for data centers, and rising borrowing costs are stalling projects. OpenAI is reportedly shifting some capacity to Microsoft and Amazon, raising concerns about Oracle's delivery capabilities.

title: 'Unlawful': Bangladesh HC questions BCB over female crickters' safety
content: The Bangladesh High Court questioned the BCB‚Äôs failure to ensure a safe, harassment-free environment for women cricketers. It asked why such inaction should not be declared ‚Äúunlawful, without lawful authority, and against public interest.‚Äù The court ordered BCB to implement its anti-sexual harassment policy and submit a report, following a writ over delayed action on harassment allegations.

title: India-US trade deal: D-Street gets Trump card, set for big gains
content: According to Siddhartha Sanyal, Chief Economist, Bandhan Bank, the news of reduction of US tariff on India is a major positive, especially soon after the trade deal with the EU. ‚ÄúThe end of the stalemate and the direction of the development is more important in this case than the quantum of the change in tariff as it opens room for further positive developments in near future.‚Äù

title: Amid threats to ‚Äòchicken‚Äôs neck‚Äô, India to take rail corridor underground
content: Ashwini Vaishnaw said the Budget contains a proposal to expand railway link between the region and the rest of the country to four tracks, fulfilling a long-felt need. Northeast Frontier Railway GM Chetan Shrivastava said the underground stretch would run from Tin Mile Haat to Rangapani stations within Bengal. During the 2017 Doklam stand-off, military planners had talked about the vulnerability of the Siliguri stretch of the corridor.

title: After 1,500 layoffs and $88bn loss, Meta CFO flags Reality Labs focus
content: Meta's Reality Labs division is shifting focus from VR to wearables, despite continued development of future VR headsets. The company confirmed a significant reduction in VR investment this year, while increasing spending on wearables like smart glasses. This strategic pivot follows substantial losses in Reality Labs, with a projected peak in 2026 before expected declines.

title: ‚ÄòNo mechanical arrests over social media posts‚Äô: SC upholds HC order
content: The SC order may end the prevalent practice harassing people by filing mulitple cases against those whose social media post is critical of govt or party in power, and safeguards fundamental rights. The guidelines say the police must verify whether the complainant qualifies as the ‚Äúperson aggrieved‚Äù in terms of law before registering a case and conduct a preliminary probe before lodging an FIR.

title: 'Border 2' collection: Sunny Deol starrer crashes on its second Monday
content: On its second Monday, 'Border 2' struggled to maintain momentum, raking in only Rs 5.75 crore. This follows a robust opening and a productive first week, yet the Sunny Deol and Varun Dhawan film has experienced a sharp drop in revenues. Portraying events from the 1971 India-Pakistan War, it has nonetheless garnered an impressive Rs 281 crore on home soil.

title: Rahul quotes from ex-Gen‚Äôs unpublished book on China row, gets Shah, Rajnath rap
content: Speaker Om Birla failed to defuse the situation even after he gave a ruling asking Gandhi not to refer to news articles or extracts from an unpublished book and speak only on what could be authenticated by placing it on record. The LoP maintained that he should be allowed to speak on the issue, saying excerpts of the unpublished book had been published in Caravan magazine and were authentic.

title: Ann Michael turns heads in bold Super Bowl workout look as Drake Maye preps
content: Ann Michael Maye kicked off Super Bowl 2026 week with a viral workout post as the Patriots prepare to face the Seahawks. From supporting Drake Maye at key playoff moments to launching her NBC Sports Boston show, Ann‚Äôs rise mirrors New England‚Äôs return to the sport‚Äôs biggest stage.

title: MLB trade rumours: Dodgers linked to $400mn Cy Young deal with Tigers
content: A potential trade between the Los Angeles Dodgers and Detroit Tigers involves Roki Sasaki for Tarik Skubal. This hypothetical deal highlights the Dodgers' focus on immediate championship contention and the Tigers' long-term roster development. The exchange would significantly alter both pitching staffs, with the Dodgers gaining a proven starter and the Tigers acquiring a young arm with future control.

title: Rockets vs Pacers injury report: who‚Äôs playing, injured, records & stats
content: The Houston Rockets, despite key injuries to Durant, Adams, and VanVleet, are favored against the Indiana Pacers on February 2, 2026. Houston's core, led by Sengun and Thompson, will aim to exploit Indiana's defensive struggles and thin rotation. The Pacers will rely heavily on Siakam to keep pace in a game projected to be moderately high-scoring.

title: Gen Naravane's memoir: Rules bar retired officers from publishing classified info
content: Senior military officials, particularly those dealing with classified information, are subject to regulations under the Official Secrets Act that restrict the publication of books or information even after retirement to prevent such classified material from becoming public. While a general one-year ‚Äúcooling-off‚Äù period exists for taking up commercial or private employment, regulations for publishing secret content require prior govt clearance.

title: Lower than Pakistan, China: In trade deal with US, India secures a favourable tariff rate
content: With this deal, India bags a place among countries facing one of the lowest tariff rates from the Donald Trump administration. Incidentally, the 18% tariff rate is lower than Pakistan‚Äôs 19%, Indonesia‚Äôs 19%.

title: 12-yr-old lured into trading Rs 85L jewellery for ‚Äòunlimited momos‚Äô
content: According to a complaint filed by the boy‚Äôs father, a temple priest, the child had grown fond of momo sold at the roadside stall. The vendors allegedly began feeding him free of cost, winning trust bite by bite. Soon came bigger offers ‚Äî food, small sums of money, loyalty. Then persuasion. Unaware of the stakes, the boy began removing jewellery from home and handing it over, police said.

title: Days after Ajit Pawar's death in plane crash, parliamentary panel flags aviation safety concerns
content: ‚ÄúNon-scheduled flights carry high-net-worth passengers with a fixed objective, an event, a meeting, a function. That creates immense pressure on pilots to land at the intended destination at all costs, even when diversion would be the safer option,‚Äù said Capt Manoj Hathi, former senior flight operations inspector at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA).

title: Bengal SIR row: Didi storms out of meet with CEC, claims being ‚Äòhumiliated‚Äô
content: Talking to reporters later in front of Nirvachan Sadan ‚Äî where a heavy police posse had gathered ‚Äî she claimed to have warned the CEC that he will end up like Jagdeep Dhankhar, seen as a reference to the former VP‚Äôs sudden resignation last year. She was accompanied by party national general secretary Abhishek Banerjee, MP Kalyan Banerjee, and 12 members from what they claimed were ‚ÄúSIR-affected families‚Äù from Bengal.

title: UP govt school principal suspended for ‚Äòforcing students to offer namaz‚Äô
content: The suspended principal told TOI: "I'd served in the same school for 20 years. I received the (suspension) letter on Sunday through an employee. It is a false case. Local residents know the truth. We've 235 students in the school -- 147 Hindus and 88 Muslims -- and all are like my children, and their education has always been my main priority."

title: Manipur set for govt, BJP MLAs to elect leader; Biren to be replaced
content: Official sources said BJP MLAs are in the national capital and will be electing a new leader, who will be sworn in as the new chief minister. The party has not officially declared a date for the legislative party meeting and named its general secretary Tarun Chugh as the central observer for the election of the new leader.

title: SC notice to govt as church body challenges anti-conversion laws
content: One of the laws challenged by the association is the nearly 60-year-old Orissa Freedom of Religion Act, 1967. Madhya Pradesh had enacted Chhattisgarh Dharma Swatantrya Adhiniyam in 1968 to prevent large-scale conversion of tribals. SC had upheld the constitutional validity of the Orissa and MP laws in 1977 in Rev Stanislaus vs State of MP case and said while the right to propagate religion is a fundamental right, it does not include right to convert.

title: Wangchuk tried to create Nepal and Bangladesh-like unrest: Govt tells SC
content: Appearing before a bench of Justices Aravind Kumar and P B Varale, solicitor general Tushar Mehta said the activist was appealing to Gen Z to come out on the street against govt to create a problem in Ladakh which is very sensitive as it shares borders with countries that are not very friendly. Responding to Wangchuk‚Äôs submission that he was holding a peaceful protest against govt on the line of Gandhian principles, the SG said, ‚ÄúGandhi was just a facade to hide his real intention of instigating violence.‚Äù

title: Rottweiler attack leaves Bengaluru woman with over 80 stitches
content: Days that once revolved around work, cuddles and caring for her breastfeeding child are now spent in a hospital bed, recovering from a brutal dog attack that has left her with more than 80 stitches across her face, throat and head ‚Äî and scars that go far beyond the physical. Early on Jan 26, Shalini had stepped out for morning walk near home in HSR Layout‚Äôs Teachers‚Äô Colony.

title: Parents to be blamed for allowing minors to drink & drive: SC
content: A bench of Justices B V Nagarathna and Ujjal Bhuyan said that there cannot be punishment before trial and directed release of the accused who already spent 18 months in jail. They were allegedly involved in tampering of evidence by swapping blood samples of their kids with their own. Father of the main accused, who is a minor and was allegedly driving the case, is still in jail.

title: For caste census, mere self-declaration cannot be enough: SC
content: Appearing for social activist Akash Goel, advocate Mukta Gupta told a bench of CJI Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi that the directorate of census operations, which has commenced preparatory work for Census 2027, has not disclosed ‚Äúany predetermined criteria or standardised methodology‚Äù for recording caste identity of people belonging to SC, ST and OBC categories during census.

title: At 90, Dalai Lama gets Grammy for audiobook ‚ÄòMeditations‚Äô
content: The Central Tibetan Administration (CTA), which is headquartered at McLeod Ganj in Dharamshala, said the award is a profound honour for Tibetan society. Although the Grammy spread cheer in this hill town, celebrations are on hold as the Dalai Lama is in Karnataka. American singer-songwriter Rufus Wainwright received the award on his behalf.

title: NCP vs NCP(SP): Bhujbal, Mushrif deny merger talks were on
content: NCP MP and state president Sunil Tatkare asked on Monday, ‚ÄúWe had taken a collective decision to join the BJP-led NDA and people of the state have stamped their approval of Ajit dada‚Äôs decision in the 2024 assembly elections. Those speaking of a merger should answer whether they are fine with it.‚Äù

title: Ram Rahim plea: HC resumes hearing in journo murder case
content: On Jan 17, 2019, a special CBI court in Panchkula had sentenced the Dera chief and three others to life imprisonment and imposed a fine of Rs 50,000 for the 2002 murder of Sirsa-based journalist Ram Chander Chhatrapati, editor of ‚ÄòPoora Sach‚Äô newspaper. Counsel for Gurmeet Ram Rahim contended that he was not named in the first chargesheet filed by police in 2002 and that his name was included in it ‚Äúby way of revenge‚Äù.

title: Two suspects detained in Samba; searches launched in Udhampur
content: On Jan 6, Punjab Police detained a minor in Pathankot on charges of spying and for allegedly sharing confidential information via social media to terror agencies, ISI, and Pakistan military officers. The detention prompted a statewide alert for similar espionage activities involving children. Under Operation Trashi-I, security forces have engaged in four encounters with terrorists in the past fortnight.

title: Let judge who convicted J&K separatist decide sentence: NIA court
content: Judge Sharma recorded that he joined the NIA court after Nov 20, 2025, whereas Judge Singh had been hearing the case since 2024 and pronounced the guilty verdict on Jan 14. Sharma also noted he received the case file only after Jan 16, by which time final arguments had already been concluded before Judge Singh.

title: Uttarakhand man who shielded Muslim trader becomes social media star: ‚ÄòI will not bow down to hatred‚Äô
content: Deepak Kumar, who intervened to protect a Muslim shopkeeper from Bajrang Dal members, has gained significant online fame. Despite facing FIRs for assault and intimidation, Kumar remains resolute, stating he would defend humanity again. The incident has drawn national attention and sparked a debate on religious tolerance and vigilantism.

title: No proof of Parth‚Äôs role, says Pune top cop on land deal
content: Asked about Parth, Pune commissioner of police (CP) Amitesh Kumar said on Monday: ‚ÄúOur investigation so far has not revealed any involvement.‚Äù Although Parth has not been named in the FIR, Digvijay Amarsinh Patil, another of Amadea‚Äôs partners, and arrested tehsildar Suryakant Yewale are mentioned. Tejwani and Patil were signatories to the deal last year.

title: How long you will live is mainly decided by your genes: Study
content: The findings are based on an analysis of more than a century of lifespan data from large Scandinavian twin cohorts in Denmark and Sweden. Researchers studied identical and non-identical twins raised together and apart, as well as siblings of US centenarians. Most participants were born between 1870 and 1935, a period marked by high mortality from infectious diseases and accidents.

title: Fresh parole for Kerala double-murder convicts sparks row, Oppn stages walkout
content: The case involves the 2019 political killing of Youth Congress workers Kripesh and Sarath Lal in Periya, a village in Kasaragod district in northern Kerala. CPM workers were convicted and handed double life terms by a trial court. Tenth accused Ranjith T was granted 15-day parole Monday, barely two-and-a-half months after similar relief earlier.

title: 3,000 illegal birth & death certificates cancelled in Maharashtra
content: The district administration conducted a thorough investigation and found that there was no record of these names. The health department raised the issue with state govt and informed the state registrar. Following directives from the state registrar, the health department started cancelling the certificates. So far, close to 3,000 certificates have been cancelled. The entire process will be completed in a week‚Äôs time.

title: Abhimanyu experiment: MP govt hosps to get Garbh Sanskar rooms to ‚Äòeducate mind of fetus‚Äô
content: These dedicated spaces are meant to guide expectant parents through prenatal care rooted in traditional Indian practices, from positive thinking and lifestyle discipline to diet and emotional well-being. The idea: shape the mind of the unborn. CM Mohan Yadav announced the initiative Sunday in Indore, placing it under the Ayushman Bharat scheme and linking it to the Union ministry of Ayush.

title: India-US trade deal: 25% penal tariffs linked to Russian oil gone? Here‚Äôs what we know
content: Donald Trump has claimed that the trade deal has been agreed after India has agreed to reduce tariffs on US goods to zero, committed to stop buying Russian crude and step up oil purchases from America, and potentially Venezuela.

content: tee shot on the first hole lands in the bunker and Max Homa's goes into the water as their team falls down 1-0 early . the team beat Atlanta 8-6, ending a losing streak that extended to January 2025 . Chris Gotterup sets the longest drive record at 374 yds .

title: Reigns, Morgan could face new opponents at WrestleMania 42
content: roman Reigns and Liv Morgan are the winners of the men's and women's royal Rumble matches . he can challenge for the championship of his choice, and he'll face an important decision . it's time to look ahead to the biggest superstars in the world on the road to Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas between now and April .

title: What did he say? Why millions ride on the words of Super Bowl announcers
content: the average amount risked on NFL announcer mention markets has grown more than seven times . since September, the average risk on the market has grown from less than half a million per game at the start of the season to $3.55 million on the AFC and NFC championship games .

title: Shaun White's next act? Revolutionizing snowboarding (again)
content: SHAUN WHITE, 39, has seen himself in a snowboard bib since he last competed at the 2022 Beijing winter Olympics . he will take a ceremonial run through the Buttermilk Mountain halfpipe to open the March 2025 contest that has brought him to town .

title: Panthers reveal custom 'Vamos Gatos' uniforms designed by Jonathan 'Rekal' Torres
content: "Vamos Gatos! Night" is the Panthers' annual celebration of the Hispanic community in south Florida . the 2025-26 jerseys, dropping on Monday, are the most intricate and intricate ones yet . this year's jerseys were designed by the very talented Rekal! graphic artist .

title: Stick with Carrick or hire another coach? Man United must decide
content: the "caretaker" is starting to back the club into a corner . the club have a window in which to decide who, why and when in terms of identifying and hiring their No. 1 candidate as permanent head coach . but the ideal scenario for United would be to wait until the end of the season and assess their options, possibly based on whether they finish in the top four or neither .

title: Super Bowl-bound Patriots follow in Mack Hollins' bare footsteps
content: a glass drops and shatters in the new England Patriots' cafeteria . a record scratch might as well ring out from the amps on the nearby practice field . Mack Hollins hasn't consistently worn shoes in the past decade .

title: After West Bengal row, non-veg back on Vande train
content:
Kamakhya-Howrah Vande sleeper goes non-veg with chicken curry

KOLKATA: Railways introduced chicken curry on Kamakhya-Howrah Vande Bharat sleeper, reversing a veg-only menu that sparked a political storm, reports Ajanta Chakraborty. The curry will vary by direction ‚Äî Assamese flavours from Kamakhya, Bengali from Howrah. Railway minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced on Sunday the change days after passengers and Trinamool Congress accused BJP-headed Centre of ‚Äúpolicing our plates‚Äù. The non-veg option is limited to chicken. Fish will not be served. IRCTC said: ‚ÄúBased on passenger feedback..., it was decided that, for the non-vegetarian option, only a chicken dish (50-60 gms boneless and 70 gms gravy) shall be served‚Ä¶‚Äù

End of Article
